column4: anyone familiar with grub errors? i'm getting "error 29: disk write error" when i try and boot into xp.  breezy boots fine
disk _write_ error?
you are sure it's from grub?
i'm presuming it is
don't presume.  You should be able to tell, though.  You don't see any windows boot up on the screen, I take it?
I don't know, but grub doesn't try to write
oh ok.
well, when i select xp, it shows the grub entry, and then that one error line below
that would appear to be coming from grub.  Let me see if grub actually does write.
you haven't made any configuration changes at the grub prompt, just a normal boot and select windows?
hang on.  you were probably right the 1st time.  i tried removing grub using fixmbr off the xp cd, and i got "error loading operating system" when i rebooted
not a good sign
i've read some forum topics, and they suggest [1]  disabling bios protection or [2]  running checkdisk off the xp cd
you can try running checkdisk.  It can't hurt.  The odds aren't good, but try it anyway
not even sure what they mean about disabling bios protection
i've never run checkdisk before. :) is it equivalent to scandisk?
it's equivalent to unix fsck
oh, ok
yes, that's correct, about moving a directory
I don't think the file system is really corrupted
I think something was deleted
by the ubuntu install?
I don't know
that's odd, I installed that a couple of days ago without a problem.
